intro: Thapsia garganica subsp. decussata, commonly known as the Garganica thapsia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas and limestone formations. Its leaves are narrow and pinnately divided, while its flowers are small and white, arranged in compound umbels. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
